poem:
**Note to a Meddler**

a song  
is a hand  
reaching beyond boundaries—  
white petals  
of a field gone untrammeled  
by closed gates—

do not take  
what you cannot feel—  
a voice rising  
where hearts listen  
and mend—  
leave it   
to the sky  
unbroken  
and free
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Something inside so wrong: Labi Siffre tells Tommy Robinson to stop using anti-apartheid anthem For decades, Labi Siffre’s hit (Something Inside) So Strong has been a global anthem against apartheid. It was inspired by a documentary about apartheid-era South Africa, and was widely reported to be Nelson Mandela’s favourite song. But now the singer-songwriter has taken the step of issuing Tommy Robinson with a cease and desist order after the far-right activist incorporated the song". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Something inside so wrong: Labi Siffre tells Tommy Robinson to stop using anti-apartheid anthem For decades, Labi Siffre’s hit (Something Inside) So Strong has been a global anthem against apartheid. It was inspired by a documentary about apartheid-era South Africa, and was widely reported to be Nelson Mandela’s favourite song. But now the singer-songwriter has taken the step of issuing Tommy Robinson with a cease and desist order after the far-right activist incorporated the song
